meanings.definition: To link together in a series or chain.
meanings.sent1: I will concatenate the beads to make a long necklace.
meanings.sent2: The train cars will concatenate to form a long line.
meanings.sent3: I tried to concatenate my socks, but they ended up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to concatenate with the music, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The children's voices concatenate into a harmonious choir.

meanings.definition: To combine or merge into a single entity.
meanings.sent1: Let's concatenate the ingredients to make a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The company will concatenate its branches to streamline operations.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally concatenate my keys with my phone in the same pocket.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes concatenate to form a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish concatenate perfectly, creating a delightful taste.
